title: 3M Is Denied Bankruptcy Shield Against Mass Earplug Claims; A bankruptcy judge won't extend to 3M the same protection against earplug-injury claims that its Aearo subsidiary gained by filing chapter 11
text:
The judge's ruling denied 3M's attempt to shift the earplug lawsuits to bankruptcy court to drive a settlement of allegations the product was defective and left U.S. military veterans with lasting hearing damage.

3M didn't immediately respond to a request for comment. It has denied that the earplugs are unsafe and said bankruptcy offers the best forum to resolve its earplug liabilities.

Shares in 3M fell 9.2% to $129.80 in late afternoon trading.

Write to Akiko Matsuda at akiko.matsuda@wsj.com
